page.title: 16MENDIP HOSPITAL 2
page.content: Other specialisms have now developed, particularly the treatment of {alcholics. Modern drug treatments have allowed people to live normal lives outside such an institution, where formerly they would have been confined. Treatment within the community is felt to be more therapeutic than institutionalisation in the Mendip Hospital. Consequently the hospital is{to close}shortly although there is much local opposition to keep it open. At present{200 people}work in the "Mendip" and the loss of the hospital will be a great blow to the area _ not least the loss of the{Mendip Hospital {Cricket Club}which was once one of the strongest local teams.
